servinfo.title: A/T System Check
servinfo.ptxt: Refer to the following items for the details of each step.

testgroup.title: Customer complaint analysis
testgroup.question: Was customer complaint analysis performed according to instruction?

testgroup.title: DTC / Freeze frame data check, record and clearance
testgroup.question: Is there any DTC (s)?

paragroup.ptxt: Print DTC and freeze frame data or write them down and clear them by referring to DTC Clearance .

testgroup.title: Rechecking and record of DTC / Freeze frame data

test1.ptxt: Recheck for DTC and freeze frame data referring to DTC Check .

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC (s)?

testgroup.title: Rechecking and record of DTC / Freeze frame data

test1.ptxt: Recheck for DTC and freeze frame data referring to DTC Check .

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC (s)?

testgroup.title: A/T Basic Check and A/T Trouble Diagnosis

test1.ptxt: Check and repair according to A/T Basic Check and A/T Symptom Diagnosis .

testgroup.question: Are check and repair complete?

test1.ptxt: Check and repair according to applicable DTC diag. flow.

testgroup.title: Final confirmation test
testgroup.question: Is there any problem symptom, DTC or abnormal condition?

servinfosub.title: Step 1. Customer Complaint Analysis
servinfosub.ptxt: Record details of the problem (failure, complaint) and how it occurred as described by the customer.
For this purpose, use of such a inspection form will facilitate collecting information to the point required for proper analysis and diagnosis.

attention3.ptxt: The form is a standard sample. It should be modified according to conditions characteristic of each market.

servinfosub.title: Step 2. DTC/Freeze Frame Data Check, Record and Clearance
servinfosub.ptxt: First, referring to DTC Check , check DTC (including pending DTC). If DTC exists, print or write down DTC and freeze frame data and then clear them by referring to DTC Clearance . DTC indicates malfunction in the system but it is not possible to know from it whether the malfunction is occurring now or it occurred in the past and normal condition has been restored. In order to know that, check symptom in question according to Step 5 and then recheck DTC according to Step 6.

Diagnosing a trouble based on the DTC in this step only or failure to clear the DTC in this step may result in an faulty diagnosis, trouble diagnosis of a normal circuit or difficulty in troubleshooting which is otherwise unnecessary.

servinfosub.title: Step 3 and Step 4. Visual Inspection
servinfosub.ptxt: As a preliminary step, be sure to perform visual check of the items that support proper function of the A/T and engine referring to Visual Inspection .

servinfosub.title: Step 5. Trouble Symptom Confirmation
servinfosub.ptxt:
Check trouble symptoms based on information obtained in Step 1
“Customer Complaint Analysis” and Step 2
“DTC/Freeze Frame Data Check, Record and Clearance”.
Also, recheck DTC according to “DTC Confirmation Procedure” described in each DTC flow.

servinfosub.title: Step 6 and Step 7. Recheck and Record of DTC / Freeze Frame Data
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC Check for checking procedure.

servinfosub.title: Step 8. A/T Basic Check and A/T Trouble Diagnosis
servinfosub.ptxt: Perform A/T basic check according to A/T Basic Check first. When the end of the flow has been reached, check the parts of the system suspected as a possible cause referring to A/T Symptom Diagnosis and based on symptoms appearing on the vehicle (symptoms obtained through steps of customer complaint analysis, trouble symptom confirmation and/or A/T basic check) and repair or replace faulty parts, if any.

servinfosub.title: Step 9. Troubleshooting for DTC
servinfosub.ptxt: Based on the DTC indicated in Step 6 and 7 and referring to applicable DTC flow, locate the cause of the trouble, namely in a sensor, switch, wire harness, connector, actuator, TCM or other part and repair or replace faulty parts.

servinfosub.title: Step 10. Check for Intermittent Problem
servinfosub.ptxt: Check parts where an intermittent trouble is easy to occur (e.g., wire harness, connector, etc.), referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection and related circuit of DTC recorded in Step 2.

servinfosub.title: Step 11. Final Confirmation Test
servinfosub.ptxt: Confirm that the problem symptom has gone and the A/T is free from any abnormal conditions.
If what has been repaired is related to the malfunction DTC, clear the DTC once, set conditions under which DTC was detected and A/T and/or vehicle was repaired and confirm that no DTC is indicated.
